summary: This document is an email chain between FBI agents discussing the imminent indictment and planned arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. It reveals coordination between FBI offices in New York and Boston/Lowell, the use of mobile tracking to locate Maxwell, and the push for an indictment by June 29, 2020, ahead of the July 4th holiday.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Target of investigation and planned arrest
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; FBI agents have a solid mobile number they believe she is using and plan to obtain a GPS warrant to locate and arrest her.

events.title: Planned indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney SDNY is pushing to indict Ghislaine Maxwell on Monday, June 29, 2020.

events.title: Briefing of ADIC
events.description: FBI agents briefed the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC), who will reach out to the U.S. Attorney SDNY to discuss the case.

events.title: Coordination for arrest
events.description: FBI agents in New York are in touch with the Boston/Lowell Resident Agency (RA) to coordinate the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell, using a GPS warrant to track her mobile phone.

keyFacts: FBI agents had a solid mobile number believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell and planned to obtain a GPS warrant to track her location.
The U.S. Attorney SDNY was pushing to indict Maxwell on Monday, June 29, 2020.
There was coordination between FBI New York and the Boston/Lowell Resident Agency to effect Maxwell's arrest, aiming to do so before the July 4th holiday.
The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) was briefed and was to reach out to the U.S. Attorney SDNY to discuss the case.
The email chain indicates active, high-level planning for Maxwell's indictment and arrest in late June 2020.
